page.title: 02 FALFIELD H.E.M.& E.C.
page.content: The centre is on 100 acres of land. Most of this land is rented out to farmers. The centre trains people to use and mend hospital equipment. This does not include the medical side of hospitals.There are 90 resident students.Extra students use bed and breakfast near the centre.The cost for NHS students is 165 pounds and for private is 320 pounds.Last year 2537 students attended the one/two week courses serviced by 19 lecturers and 5 demonstrators.The budget for the centre is 400,000 pounds.The centre was formerly a Civil Defence building but was taken over by the NHS Works/Dept. of Training in 1969 and in April 1984 was changed entirely to NHS training.The other main centre for this type of training is at Harrogate.
